title: The week in tennis: Sinner cements the No. 1 ranking, Nadal sets retirement date
description: Sinner will end the year at No. 1 -- while Sabalenka has a chance to as well. And Nadal confirmed his final tournament.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Forehands, titles and what-ifs: How Rafael Nadal broke tennis math
description: As Rafael Nadal announces his upcoming retirement, it's worth remembering just how much he stands out when looking at the raw numbers.
author: Bill Connelly

title: The Best Tennis Players Do These 3 Things - Essential Tennis Podcast #412
description: If you want to be a great tennis player then you MUST do the three things revealed in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, PERIOD. The best players on your local courts do them and the weakest ones don‚Äôt, so don‚Äôt miss any of these insights because they‚Äôll level up your game fast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Advanced Doubles Tactics - Essential Tennis Podcast #411
description: If you‚Äôre a doubles player looking to take your game to the next level then this is the episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast you've been waiting for. You‚Äôre about to learn 3 advanced tactics that will pressure your opponents and win you free points.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: ‚ÄòOne last dance!': Retiring Thiem honoured in special Sunday ceremony in Vienna
description: The celebration of Dominic Thiem's storied career has begun at the Erste Bank Open. The former No. 3 in the PIF ATP Rankings was honoured on a special 'Super Sunday' at the indoor hard-court ATP 500 in Vienna. After Thiem played an exhibition set against Alexander Zverev ‚Äî the man he defeated to win his only major title at the 2020 US Open ‚Äî a host of tennis and other sporting icons gathered to pay tribute to the retiring star. ‚ÄúIt was an incredible journey. You were the most important ones, opponents and friends and it was always a pleasure to be with you,‚Äù said Thiem after walking through a guard of honour that included his ATP Tour rivals Frances Tiafoe, Matteo Berrettini and Jack Draper, as well as his former coach Nicolas Massu and Germans Boris Becker, Tommy Haas and Matthias Bachinger. ‚ÄúIt means so much to me that you were there today.‚Äù Things we love to see ü§ó#DankeDomi | @ErsteBankOpen pic.twitter.com/Rzvtm4RX51‚Äî ATP Tour (@atptour) October 20, 2024 Thiem is a huge star in Austria and has been a highly popular presence on the ATP Tour with fans and fellow players alike since he turned pro in 2011. He lifted 17 tour-level trophies before his career was disrupted by a serious wrist injury in 2021. Although he returned to competing in 2022, he was unable to rediscover his best form and announced in May that 2024 would be his final season on Tour. Thiem still has one final ATP Tour event to play before he hangs up his racquet. The 31-year-old will take on Luciano Darderi in the first-round in Vienna, where he lifted the title in 2019. ‚ÄúI couldn't have imagined a better last Sunday in Vienna. I hope to see many of you again on Tuesday,‚Äù said Thiem to his home crowd. ‚ÄúIt hurts incredibly that the journey is over, but it was a wonderful time.‚Äù Former rivals of Thiem to pay tribute to the Austrian at the Wiener Stadthalle included Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic, who appeared in a pre-recorded tribute video. Thiem is one of only two players (alongside Andy Murray) to have earned at least five Lexus ATP Head2Head victories against each of the ‚ÄòBig Three‚Äô. ‚ÄúYou were always a super guy, also off the court,‚Äù said Federer in German. ‚ÄúAlways fair. Your friendship was important on the Tour. We always got on well, and it was great for me. All the best with the future, and huge congratulations on your unbelievable career, Dominic. I am sure we will see each other soon, but for now, have a great evening.‚Äù Djokovic said: ‚ÄúThank you very much for all that you have given to all of us, but particularly tennis. I‚Äôm glad that you have the opportunity to say goodbye in Vienna. One last dance. I wish you a great tournament, with all your family members present, and celebrate it, because you deserve it my friend. All the best.‚Äù Zverev earlier also made his own tribute on court. ‚ÄúFirst and foremost, I'm losing a friend on the Tour, but of course we also played the greatest matches together. But it's goodbye, not goodbye,‚Äù said the German, expressing what many Thiem fans are thinking: ‚ÄùI hope he gets bored in a year or two and comes back to the Tour again.‚Äù [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: What is the Vienna tennis schedule?
description: Top seed Alexander Zverev and Matteo Berrettini are among the stars headlining action on Monday at the Erste Bank Open. Zverev will be aiming to reignite the form that drove him to success in the Austrian capital in 2021 when he gets his 2024 campaign underway against #NextGenATP wild card Joel Schwaerzler. Berrettini eyes a fourth ATP Tour title of the year and faces qualifier Marton Fucsovics in his opener. View the full Monday order of play below to see who is competing, on which court, and when they are scheduled. [ATP APP] ORDER OF PLAY - MONDAY, 21 OCTOBER 2024 Center Court - start at 2pm¬† Flavio Cobolli (ITA) vs Alejandro Davidovich Fokina (ESP) [Q] Marton Fucsovics vs Matteo Berrettini (ITA) Not Before 6pm [1] Alexander Zverev (GER) vs [WC] Joel Schwaerzler (AUT) [8] Alexei Popyrin (AUS) vs [Q] Jakub Mensik (CZE) #Glaubandich - start 2pm Rafael Matos (BRA) / Marcelo Melo (BRA) vs Neal Skupski (GBR) / Michael Venus (NZL) [1] Marcelo Arevalo (ESA) / Mate Pavic (CRO) vs Luciano Darderi (ITA) / Mariano Navone (ARG) Sander Gille (BEL) / Joran Vliegen (BEL) vs [4] Nathaniel Lammons (USA) / Jackson Withrow (USA) [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Kasatkina battles past Andreeva to win Ningbo Open
description: Daria Kasatkina overcomes a stirring comeback from fellow Russian Mirra Andreeva to win 6-0 4-6 6-4 in the final of the Ningbo Open in China.

title: Djokovic beats Nadal as 'amazing rivalry' ends
description: Rafael Nadal reflects on an "amazing rivalry" with Novak Djokovic after losing their final meeting as professionals.

title: Jannik Sinner‚Äôs Doping Scandal: Why the Silence from Tennis Media?
description: When news broke that Italian tennis star Jannik Sinner tested positive for the banned substance clostebol twice, one might have expected a media storm. After all, doping scandals in sports, especially involving top athletes, usually lead to days, if not weeks, of intensive coverage, punditry, and endless headlines. Yet here we are, two months later, ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan

title: Sinner Defeats Djokovic to Win Shanghai Rolex Masters
description: Jannik Sinner is the 2024 Shanghai Masters champion after defeating Novak Djokovic 7-6(4), 6-3. Another clean performance from him and the typical display of precision hitting that has propelled him to the world‚Äôs number-one spot this season. The Italian headed in as the betting favourite, and after a tight first set that resulted in a ‚Ä¶
author: Jonathan
